column4: hi guys, i created some tasks that should be started on system startup
so i created them in /etc/rc2.d
but when i start KSysv, the tasks are listed in runlevel 2, but they are not in the column "Available Services"
how can i make sure they are also in that list ?
is that the services-admin utility from the menu?
ahh yea, it's very partial as to what info you get :) best way is to use the rc.d utilities from the command line
mmm time to use man rc.d i suppose ?
well, there's a collection of utils .. what are you trying to do now?
well, you should not enable services like that 00 you should place your scripts in /etc/init.d and then use the update-rc.d command
as for getting more services listed in the services-admin util, i dont think there's a way -- as i said, you get all the info you need in a terminal
well i've installed xammp for linux and had to create the services by hand
yes it is
well, i cant be sure, i've changed things like that around so much, i dont know what the defaults are
you can use runlevel command to check it
i just cat /etc/inittab :)
there is no /etc/inittab on ubuntu as far as i know
there is if you use sysvinit instead of upstart
ah... again learned something
what is the difference between those two anyway ?
sysvinit is what the rest of the linux world uses -- the plain old init .. upstart is ubuntu's "enhancement" of it
ah ic, did not know that
